name: PhysicsEditor License Key
summary: Learn about .PEKEY files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: PhysicsEditor allows video game developers to import sprites and create collision shapes associated with those sprites. Developers can then export the collision shapes they've created in a variety of formats, for use with different game development engines.

After a user purchases PhysicsEditor, CodeandWeb supplies that user with a license key they can use to register their copy of the program. These license keys are provided via email and may sometimes be saved within PEKEY files. Users can also view their current CodeAndWeb licenses within the company's online license manager.

instructions: You can open a PEKEY file with Microsoft Notepad (Windows), Apple TextEdit (Mac), or any other text editor, to retrieve the license key it contains.
In the window that appears, enter your license key, then click Activate.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
